text: A student shall be able to search study rooms with available seats by campus, date, and time range.
When the student is authenticated, the system shall allow reserving one or more seats in a study room for a chosen time slot.
If the selected study room has insufficient available seats for the requested time slot, the system shall reject the reservation and suggest the nearest available slots.
A reservation shall include the room identifier, date, start time, end time, and the number of seats requested.
The system shall prevent a student from booking more than 2 active reservations per day and more than 6 per week.
If the student already has an active booking for the same time range, the system shall block creating another booking for that time range.
A student shall be able to cancel a booking up to 30 minutes before the start time; otherwise, the system shall mark it as late-cancel.
If a reservation is canceled, the system shall immediately release the reserved seats and notify students on the waitlist, if any.
A student shall be able to join a waitlist for a fully booked room on a specific date.
When a room becomes available, the system shall offer the slot to the first student on the waitlist and give 10 minutes to confirm.
If the student does not confirm within 10 minutes, the system shall offer the slot to the next student on the waitlist.
The system shall send a booking confirmation via email and in-app notification within 1 minute after a successful reservation.
A student shall be able to check in for a seat reservation starting 10 minutes before the start time until 15 minutes after the start time.
If no check-in occurs by 15 minutes after the start time, the system shall automatically cancel the booking and record a no-show.
If a no-show is recorded three times within 30 days, the system shall suspend the student's booking privileges for 7 days.
The system shall display room capacity, equipment (e.g., whiteboard, projector), and accessibility features before booking.
A student shall be able to filter rooms by minimum capacity and required equipment.
If the number of seats requested exceeds the remaining available seats, the system shall prevent the reservation and explain the capacity constraint.
A student shall be able to modify an existing reservation only if the new time slot satisfies booking limits and does not overlap the student's other reservations.
The system shall log all booking creations, modifications, cancellations, and no-show events with timestamp and user ID.
Administrative staff shall be able to create rooms and define their campus, opening hours, and maximum reservation length.
The system shall enforce that no reservation can exceed the maximum reservation length defined for that room.
If a student attempts to book outside the room opening hours, the system shall reject the request and show valid hours.
The system shall allow staff to block a room for maintenance; during maintenance, the room shall not appear as available.
If a maintenance block overlaps existing bookings, the system shall notify affected students and offer alternative rooms of similar capacity.
The system shall support group bookings where a student invites other students; invited students shall receive an invite and can accept or decline.
If fewer than 50% of invited students accept by 2 hours before the start time, the system shall prompt the organizer to confirm or cancel.
The system shall allow the organizer to remove an invited student before the booking start time and notify the removed student.
The system shall provide a calendar view of a student's upcoming bookings and allow exporting as iCalendar (.ics).
The system shall support single sign-on using the university identity provider; unauthenticated users shall have read-only access to availability.
The system shall store personal data (name, email, student ID) encrypted at rest and transmit it over TLS.
A student shall be able to report a room issue (e.g., broken equipment); the system shall create a ticket and notify staff.
If a room issue is marked as critical by staff, the system shall automatically block the room until the issue is resolved.
The system shall display a fair-use policy and require explicit acceptance before the first booking.
If the student violates the fair-use policy (e.g., repeated no-shows), the system shall warn the student and escalate penalties on repeat.
The system shall provide administrative reports showing utilization rate per room and peak booking hours for the last 30 days.
For any search query, the system shall return results within 2 seconds for 95% of requests under normal load.
If the notification service is unavailable, the system shall queue notifications and retry for up to 24 hours without losing booking data.
The system shall support English and Italian UI languages, and the user shall be able to switch language in settings.

If two reservation requests for the same room and time slot arrive concurrently and the remaining seats are insufficient, the system shall allocate seats atomically so that capacity is never exceeded and the losing request receives a conflict error.
A student shall be able to create a recurring weekly seat reservation for the same room and time slot for up to 4 consecutive weeks, provided all occurrences satisfy booking limits and opening hours.
If a student checks in after the reservation start time, the system shall keep the original end time and shall not extend the reservation duration.
The system shall display the building, floor, and a link to the room floor plan before a student confirms a booking.
Administrative staff shall be able to define a cleaning buffer time between bookings for each room (e.g., 10 minutes), and the system shall prevent bookings that violate the buffer.
When occupancy sensors are available for a room, the system shall automatically record check-in if occupancy is detected within the allowed check-in window.
The system shall achieve at least 99.5% monthly uptime excluding scheduled maintenance windows announced in advance.
All public API endpoints shall enforce rate limiting of 60 requests per minute per user; if the limit is exceeded, the system shall return an HTTP 429 error and a retry-after time.
Unauthenticated users shall be able to view room availability and room features, but the system shall hide personal booking details and user identifiers.
Staff actions that change system state (e.g., creating rooms, blocking rooms, marking issues critical) shall require role-based access control and shall be recorded in an immutable audit log.
If a student reports that a booked room is occupied by others at the start time, the system shall create a priority ticket for staff and offer alternative rooms of similar capacity when available.

Before the student can submit a reservation request, the student must be authenticated. When the student submits a reservation request, the system shall approve the reservation if the room is available, so that the student can secure a seat.

Before the student can submit a reservation request, the student must be registered. When the student submits a reservation request, the system shall approve the reservation if the time slot is within opening hours, so that the schedule stays accurate.

Before the student can submit a reservation request, the student must be verified. When the student submits a reservation request, the system shall approve the reservation if the reservation does not overlap another booking, so that double bookings are prevented.

Before the student can submit a reservation request, the student must be in good standing. When the student submits a reservation request, the system shall approve the reservation if the user has no unpaid penalties, so that resources are used efficiently.

Before the student can submit a reservation request, the student must be authorized. When the student submits a reservation request, the system shall approve the reservation if the request is complete, so that the waitlist remains fair.

Before the student can cancel a reservation, the student must be authenticated. When the student cancels a reservation, the system shall confirm the cancellation if the reservation exists, so that the room schedule stays accurate.

Before the student can cancel a reservation, the student must be registered. When the student cancels a reservation, the system shall confirm the cancellation if the cancellation is within 24 hours of the start time, so that unused seats are released.

Before the student can cancel a reservation, the student must be verified. When the student cancels a reservation, the system shall confirm the cancellation if the reservation is active, so that penalties are applied consistently.

Before the student can cancel a reservation, the student must be in good standing. When the student cancels a reservation, the system shall confirm the cancellation if the user is the owner of the reservation, so that administrators can track usage.

Before the student can cancel a reservation, the student must be authorized. When the student cancels a reservation, the system shall confirm the cancellation if the request is complete, so that other students can book the slot.

Before the student can extend a reservation, the student must be authenticated. When the student extends a reservation, the system shall update the end time if the room is available, so that the student can finish the session.

Before the student can extend a reservation, the student must be registered. When the student extends a reservation, the system shall update the end time if the extension does not exceed the maximum duration, so that double bookings are prevented.

Before the student can extend a reservation, the student must be verified. When the student extends a reservation, the system shall update the end time if the reservation is active, so that capacity limits are enforced.

Before the student can extend a reservation, the student must be in good standing. When the student extends a reservation, the system shall update the end time if the time slot is within opening hours, so that the schedule stays accurate.

Before the student can extend a reservation, the student must be authorized. When the student extends a reservation, the system shall update the end time if the request is complete, so that resources are used efficiently.

Before the student can join the waitlist, the student must be authenticated. When the student joins the waitlist, the system shall add the student to the waitlist if the room is full, so that the waitlist remains fair.

Before the student can join the waitlist, the student must be registered. When the student joins the waitlist, the system shall add the student to the waitlist if the time slot is within opening hours, so that cancellations can be reused.

Before the student can join the waitlist, the student must be verified. When the student joins the waitlist, the system shall add the student to the waitlist if the user has no unpaid penalties, so that students can secure a seat.

Before the student can join the waitlist, the student must be in good standing. When the student joins the waitlist, the system shall add the student to the waitlist if the waitlist is open, so that the system tracks demand.

Before the student can join the waitlist, the student must be authorized. When the student joins the waitlist, the system shall add the student to the waitlist if the request is complete, so that resources are used efficiently.

Before the student can check in to the room, the student must be authenticated. When the student checks in to the room, the system shall record the check-in if the reservation is active, so that no-shows are reduced.

Before the student can check in to the room, the student must be registered. When the student checks in to the room, the system shall record the check-in if the check-in window has started, so that the system records attendance.

Before the student can check in to the room, the student must be verified. When the student checks in to the room, the system shall record the check-in if the user has a valid ID card, so that penalties are applied fairly.

Before the student can check in to the room, the student must be in good standing. When the student checks in to the room, the system shall record the check-in if the room is available, so that seat usage is tracked.

Before the student can check in to the room, the student must be authorized. When the student checks in to the room, the system shall record the check-in if the request is complete, so that resources are used efficiently.

Before the student can request a room change, the student must be authenticated. When the student requests a room change, the system shall update the room assignment if the room is unavailable, so that the student can continue studying.

Before the student can request a room change, the student must be registered. When the student requests a room change, the system shall update the room assignment if the new room has enough seats, so that the schedule stays accurate.

Before the student can request a room change, the student must be verified. When the student requests a room change, the system shall update the room assignment if the reservation is active, so that capacity limits are enforced.

Before the student can request a room change, the student must be in good standing. When the student requests a room change, the system shall update the room assignment if the request is complete, so that double bookings are prevented.

Before the student can request a room change, the student must be authorized. When the student requests a room change, the system shall update the room assignment if the change is within opening hours, so that resources are used efficiently.

Before the student can report a room issue, the student must be authenticated. When the student reports a room issue, the system shall log the issue if the room is in use, so that issues are resolved quickly.

Before the student can report a room issue, the student must be registered. When the student reports a room issue, the system shall log the issue if the report includes a description, so that maintenance is scheduled promptly.

Before the student can report a room issue, the student must be verified. When the student reports a room issue, the system shall log the issue if the request is complete, so that safety risks are reduced.

Before the student can report a room issue, the student must be in good standing. When the student reports a room issue, the system shall log the issue if the issue is not already reported, so that the system tracks recurring problems.

Before the student can report a room issue, the student must be authorized. When the student reports a room issue, the system shall log the issue if the room is under maintenance, so that administrators can prioritize repairs.

Before the student can request a group booking, the student must be authenticated. When the student requests a group booking, the system shall schedule the group booking if the group size does not exceed capacity, so that group study is supported.

Before the student can request a group booking, the student must be registered. When the student requests a group booking, the system shall schedule the group booking if the room is available, so that capacity limits are enforced.

Before the student can request a group booking, the student must be verified. When the student requests a group booking, the system shall schedule the group booking if the request is complete, so that double bookings are prevented.

Before the student can request a group booking, the student must be in good standing. When the student requests a group booking, the system shall schedule the group booking if the group has a designated leader, so that the schedule stays accurate.

Before the student can request a group booking, the student must be authorized. When the student requests a group booking, the system shall schedule the group booking if the time slot is within opening hours, so that resources are used efficiently.

Before the administrator can upload a room photo, the administrator must be authorized. When the administrator uploads a room photo, the system shall store the photo if the room exists, so that room listings are accurate.

Before the administrator can upload a room photo, the administrator must be authenticated. When the administrator uploads a room photo, the system shall store the photo if the photo meets the size limit, so that students can identify the room.

Before the administrator can upload a room photo, the administrator must be verified. When the administrator uploads a room photo, the system shall store the photo if the request is complete, so that administrators can update assets.

Before the administrator can upload a room photo, the administrator must be assigned to the role. When the administrator uploads a room photo, the system shall store the photo if the room is not under maintenance, so that the room catalog stays current.

Before the administrator can upload a room photo, the administrator must be approved. When the administrator uploads a room photo, the system shall store the photo if the administrator is assigned to the room, so that quality issues are detected.

Before the administrator can export a usage report, the administrator must be authorized. When the administrator exports a usage report, the system shall generate the report if the reporting period is selected, so that administrators can track usage.

Before the administrator can export a usage report, the administrator must be authenticated. When the administrator exports a usage report, the system shall generate the report if the request is complete, so that capacity planning is supported.

Before the administrator can export a usage report, the administrator must be verified. When the administrator exports a usage report, the system shall generate the report if the administrator has reporting access, so that policy decisions are informed.

Before the administrator can export a usage report, the administrator must be assigned to the role. When the administrator exports a usage report, the system shall generate the report if the system is available, so that peak hours are identified.

Before the administrator can export a usage report, the administrator must be approved. When the administrator exports a usage report, the system shall generate the report if the dataset is up to date, so that resources are allocated efficiently.
